Fashion has now reached one of the last strongholds of traditional styling in the home-- venetian blinds and window shades.
Richard Tucker, a leading tenor of the Metropolitan Opera, announced yesterday that he would appear on a television program next month despite an attempt by the Met "to block [his] appearance."

Hospital Commissioner Basil C. MacLean tailed yesterdayat least temporarily--to persuade the Board of Estimate that it should reactivate the post of Director of Tuberculosis. The job has been dormant for eight years.

A retired railroad equipment engineer told yesterday how he had intentionally let a New York Central train of 100 tank cars fly apart at fifty-one miles an hour to solve a World War II transportation problem.

LAMB chops, though still a luxury item at meat counters, dropped sharply in price this week as a result of unusually heavy shipments. Loin lamb chops are down 9 cents to $1.10 a pound, shoulder chops are down 6 cents to 79 a pound.

The Henry C. Fullan pawnbroker establishment that did business for about eighty years at 659 Tenth Avenue has sold the four-story building. After extensive alterations, Rama Records, Inc., will occupy the structure under lease.

"Candide," a comic operetta based on Voltaire's satire, will make its Broadway debut at the Martin Beck Theatre at 8 o'clock tonight.
A suit for $1,040,000 has been filed against the New York Central, the Pennsylvania, the Erie and the Baltimore and Ohio Railroads by a group of fruit and produce handlers.
BALTIMORE, Nov. 30 (AP)-- Besomer, an unsuccessful candidate in the Kentucky Derby last spring, won Pimlico's $3,800 Harford County Purse today in easy fashion.

In a vigorous rally that seemed supported chiefly by technical factors, the stock market yesterday reversed a decline of almost four weeks with the sharpest advance since May 29. Steels, oils, chemicals and metals led the climb.
HAVANA, Nov. 30--Small groups of insurgents made lightning attacks on police stations and rural guard posts in the eastern province of Oriente today.

LONDON, Nov. 30--The stock market presented a brighter appearance today than for some time. Although Government funds were unable to hold early gains, industrial and oil shares improved and some had substantial price rises.

Two planes loaded with refugees from Hungary--the tenth and eleventh to reach this country--arrived at McGuire Air Force Base in New Jersey yesterday. The 139 Hungarians aboard swelled to 845 the total brought into the United States.

The Premier of Tunisia reaffirmed yesterday his country's neutral position among Arab nations and her alliance with the free world.

Theodore R. Reyling of the Sea Cliff Yacht Club was elected chairman of the Atlantic Class Association at the annual meeting in the New York Yacht Club last night.

Two persons were injured yesterday when a helicopter crashed and burned at LaGuardia Airport in Queens. An injured passenger crawled from the wreck to help beat out flames in the clothing of the more seriously hurt pilot.

The Waterfront Commission yesterday took the initial steps in a program to cull from the present ranks of pier watchmen all who are not fulfilling their responsibilities because of advanced age or physical incapability.

There have been few manifestations of the human spirit in all recorded history so moving and so impressive as that of the Hungarian people in recent weeks. This is one of the glorious pages in the long, unending but never losing battle of humanity for freedom.
An order from Dave Beck, international president of the teamsters union, to seat Johnny Dio's seven paper locals was ignored yesterday by the executive committee of the Teamsters Joint Council here.

SYRACUSE, N. Y., Dec. 4 (AP) --Holders of the common stock of the Niagara Mohawk Power Corporation, at a special meeting here today, authorized the corporatieon to issue convertible debentures in an amount not exceeding $50,000,000.
The case of three men charged with conspiracy in the acid-blinding of Victor Riesel will go to a Federal court jury today or tomorrow. The jury consists of eight men and four women.
